comments.body: This is a pretty common pattern where we need to bridge the new and old APIs. We construct the "record" by filling in the timestamp and headers from the context.

I forget why now, but it was necessary to revise the generic params on source and sink nodes. Source nodes are always just pass-thoughs, and sink nodes can't forward, so their output types are Void. In both cases, it means they only need two generic parameters now, so I had to change like 100 declarations like this.
